messages.title: A different kind of MP
messages.content: David Heath isn't 'just like all the rest'.

messages.title: Somerset schools got a fair deal?
messages.content: Every year, Somerset schools get less cash to pay for teaching, equipment, and buildings than other areas of the country. Why should our children be treated as second class?

messages.title: Keep pubs at heart of our rural communities says Heath
messages.content: The first job of the local Member of Parliament is to stand up for his community. That's what I have been doing over the controversial issue of pub closures.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Advocates for fair funding for Somerset schools, highlighting that they receive less cash for teaching and facilities compared to other areas.
Supports the protection and development of local businesses, particularly pubs, as central to rural community life.

issues.economy: Emphasis on the significance of small and medium businesses to pull the country out of recession.
issues.education: Stressing the unfair deal that Somerset schools receive in terms of funding compared to other regions.

leaflet.personalStatement: A lot of people say 'They're all the same'. Somerset Today takes a closer look at a local MP who stands out as just a little different...

politicalExperience.achievements: Fighting for local concerns; instrumental in saving the local Royal Naval Armament Depot; active in campaigns such as Laura's campaign aimed at combating online bullying and harassment.

quotes.text: I wish every MP was like our MP

images.caption: David Heath interacting with various community groups and engaging in local issues.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet contains various instances where David Heath's involvement in local issues is highlighted, suggesting a focus on community engagement and support for local enterprises such as schools and pubs.
